page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: {Huntingdon}evolved as and still is a large market town.The High Street is a Roman road .It was,at one time,a major inland port but the river has since silted up.In addition{Oliver Cromwell was born here. In the Huntingdon area there are many places of interest.We have two historic houses, Hinchingbrooke House (now a school)and{Pepy's House}(once home to the famous diarist.) There is a race course,an RAF base,a large water meadow,several schools and a huge network of roads in the area. Because of the latter many major emergency services have headquarters in Huntingdon.There is a fire and rescue HQ as well as a fire station,a Police station,a forensic laboratory and a modern hospital.
